metadata.Title: CVE-2018-17479 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect object lifetime calculations in GPU code in Google Chrome prior to 70.0.3538.110 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0.3538.110-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
